page.title: 13FIRST YEAR AT GRAMMAR SCHOOL
page.content:
{"Hoyle Road School,}built in 1909, was originally a place where there were Pierrot Shows. For 7 years it has been used as an annexe for first year pupils of West Kirby Grammar School.
The worst things about Hoyle Road are the outside toilets and having to walk along the prom, in all weathers, to dinner. There are no fields to play on, so when we play tennis, we have to cross the road to the public courts.
There are 24 rooms including the staffroom, office and sick bay.
This annexe closes on 17th July 1985 and I don't know what will happen to the building after we have gone. They might use it for a youth club or a night school."
